turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Uuuuugh!

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Oh boy.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm such an asshole.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: She wasn't your type anyway.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I think I'm gonna move Back East.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Well, that's dumb.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What's dumb about it?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Well, you're doing so well...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: How am I doing well? I host an open mike and I played a fuckin' bus driver in a movie. Big fuckin' deal. I'm with an agency that specializes in fuckin magicians. How good am I doing?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: At least you didn't get turned down for Goofy...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: They turned you down?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: They went for someone with more theme park experience. I woulda killed for that job.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: See, it's all how you look at it. If your life sucks, then mine is God awful. I mean, I moved out here partially because I saw how well you were doing. You got in the union, you got an agent. I thought if you could make it, maybe I could too...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I didn't make it...

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: That's your problem, man. You can't see what you've got, only what you've lost. Those guys are right. You are "money".

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Then why won't she call...?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Because you left, man. She's got her own world to deal with in New York. She was a sweet girl but fuck her. You gotta move on. You gotta let go of the past. The future is so beautiful. Every day is so sunny out here. It's like Manifest Destiny man. I mean, we made it. What's past is prologue. That which does not kill us makes us stronger. All that shit. You'll get over it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: How did you get over it? I mean how long 'til it stopped hurting?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Sometimes is still hurts. You know how it is, man. I mean, each day you think about it less and less. And then one day you wake up and you don't think of it at all, and you almost miss that feeling. It's kinda weird. You miss the pain because it was part of your life for so long. And the, boom, something reminds you of her, and you just smile that bittersweet smile.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You miss the pain?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: ...for the same reason you miss her. You lived with it so long.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Wow.  You wanna grab a bite?

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: ROB
turns.text: By the way, the guys back home said she put on some weight.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You always know the right thing to say.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You little bitch!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hey Sue. Gretsky's on his ass again.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You should play another team. The Kings are bitches in this game.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Hey, man. I took the Kings to the Cup.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: It's kinda money, actually.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Make someone bleed.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: No, man, we're in the play-offs.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Pause it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Give me the money. I'll get it.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...which means no one will get there 'til ten.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: So, what? Eleven?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What's he do?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: He's trying to be an actor.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...How can you compare them? Tarantino totally bites everything from Scorsese...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...He's derivative...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Who threw this party, anyway?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Damned if I know...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: How's it going for you two?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Not well.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Rejected?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Big butt... you know, can't fly coach.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I can't believe you.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: She was cute.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She didn't like me... I made a fool of myself...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: He's a bitch. He ain't gonna do nothing.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You asshole.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You asshole. Why are you carrying a gun? What? In case someone steps to you, Snoop Dogg?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Hey, man, you're not from here. You don't know how it is. I grew up in L.A...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah. Here it's easier to avoid trouble. It's not like you like in Compton where bullets are whizzing by your head every day. Nobody's mugging you on no subway. In New York the trouble finds you. Out here you gotta go look for it...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...People get carjacked...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You live in such a fantasy world...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What about you, Mikey? At least I got balls. You're always whining about some bitch who dumped you a year ago...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...It was six months, and she didn't dump...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...Whatever. You're like a whining little woman. Big deal. You got a fuckin' number. Whoopee! You'll fuck it up...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I'm so sorry, man. You were so right. I got rid of the gun

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What are they doing here?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: We ran into them that night at Roscoe's. Tee cleared it up, I apologized, bought them some chicken and waffles. They fuckin love Tee. That boy can talk.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: But most important, man, I'm sorry about what I said. I was drunk... My adrenaline was going...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Don't sweat it, man. I needed a kick in the ass. We're better friends for it.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Thanks, man.  I've been hating myself for the last two days.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Believe me, I know what that's like.  Yo, Double Down! What time are we leaving?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Good for you, man. He's being smart.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She's really special, guys.

turns.speaker: NIKKI
turns.text: Hi. This is Nikki. Leave a message.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hi, Nikki. This is Mike. I met you tonight at the Dresden. I, uh, just called to say I, uh, I'm really glad we met and you should give me a call. So call me tomorrow, or, like, in two days, whatever. My number is 213- 555-4679...

turns.speaker: NIKKI
turns.text: Hi. This is Nikki. Leave a message.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hi, Nikki. This is Mike, again. I just called because it sounded like your machine might've cut me off before I gave you my number, and also to say sorry for calling so late, but you were still there when I left the Dresden, so I knew I'd get your machine. Anyway, my number is...

turns.speaker: NIKKI
turns.text: Hi. This is Nikki. Leave a message.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: 213-555-4679. That's all. I just wanted to leave my number. I don't want you to think I'm weird, or desperate or something...  ...I mean, you know, we should just hang out. That's it. No expectations. Just, you know, hang out. Bye.

turns.speaker: NIKKI
turns.text: Hi. This is Nikki. Leaves a message.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I just got out of a six-year relationship. Okay? That should help to explain why I'm acting so weird. It's not you. It's me. I just wanted to say that. Sorry.  This is Mike.

turns.speaker: NIKKI
turns.text: Hi. This is Nikki. Leave a message.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hi, Nikki. This is Mike again. Could you just call me when you get in? I'll be up for awhile, and I'd just rather talk to you in person instead of trying to squeeze it all...

turns.speaker: NIKKI
turns.text: Hi. This is Nikki. Leave a message.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hi, Nikki. Mike. I don't think this is working out. I think you're great, but maybe we should just take some time off from each other. It's not you, really. It's me. It's only been six months...

turns.speaker: NIKKI
turns.text: Mike?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Nikki! Great! Did you just walk in, or were you listening all along?

turns.speaker: NIKKI
turns.text: Don't call me ever again.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Wow, I guess you were home...

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: There you two are. I walked around for an hour with that stupid martini on my tray.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Sorry. We got knocked out pretty quickly.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Are you ready to order?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Coffee...  Two coffees. It says "Breakfast Any Time", right?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'll have "pancakes in the Age of Enlightenment".

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Excuse me. We're in a bit of a hurry.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Hang on, Voltaire.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: S'up Trent?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Lemme get off the other line, baby.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: That was Sue. We got two parties tonight. One's for a modeling agency.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Listen to me, baby, there are going to be beautiful babies there.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Trent, I don't feel like going out tonight. I got shit to do tomorrow...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Listen to you. I got an audition for a pilot at nine and I'm going. You gotta get out with some beautiful babies. You can't sit home thinking about her.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I don't know, I don't know -- listen to you. We're gonna have fun tonight. We gotta get you out of that stuffy apartment.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: We're gonna spend half the night driving around the Hills looking for this party and then leaving cause it sucks, then we're gonna look for this other party you heard about. But, Trent, all the parties and bars, they all suck. I spend half the night trying to talk to some girl who's eyes are darting around to see if there's someone else she should be talking to. And it's like I'm supposed to be all happy cause she's wearing a backpack. Half of them are nasty skanks who wouldn't be shit if they weren't surrounded by a bunch of drunken horny assholes. I'm not gonna be one of those assholes. It's fucking depressing. Some skank who isn't half the woman my girlfriend is is gonna front me? It makes me want to puke.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You got it bad, baby. You need Vegas.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What are you talking about? Vegas?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: VEGAS.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What Vegas?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: We're going to Vegas.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Tonight, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You're crazy.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I'll pick you up in a half an hour.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm not going to Vegas.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Shut up -- yes you are. Now listen to Tee. We'll stop at a cash machine on the way.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I can't lose more than a hundred.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Just bring your card. Half an hour.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What are you wearing? I mean, we should wear suits.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Oh... Now Mikey wants to be a high roller.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No, seriously, if you're dressed nice and you act like you gamble a lot, they give you free shit.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Okay Bugsy. Twenty minutes.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Wear a suit, I'm telling you it works.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Be downstairs. You're beautiful.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I took out three hundred, but I'm only gonna bet with one. I figure if we buy a lot of chips, the pit boss will see and they'll comp us all sorts of shit, then we trade back the chips at the end of the night. You gotta be cool though.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I'm cool, baby. They're gonna give Daddy a room, some breakfast, maybe Bennett's singing.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm serious. This is how you do it. I'm telling you.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I know. Daddy's gonna get the Rainman suite. Vegas, baby. We're going to Vegas!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Vegas! You think we'll get there by midnight?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, we're gonna be up by five hundy by midnight. Vegas, baby!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Vegas!

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Vegas, baby!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Vegas!

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Vegas.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Vegas.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Wake up, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Whu?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Look at it, baby. Vegas, baby!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Pirates of the fucking Caribbean.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: This is the hot new place, besides, you love pirates. Tell me Mikey doesn't love pirates.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: This is fuckin' post-pubescent Disneyland.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You gotta love the pirates, baby. The pirates are money.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: This place is dead. I thought this was the city that never sleeps.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: That's New York, baby. You should know that. Look at the waitresses. I'm gonna get me a peg-leg baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: They're all skanks.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, there are beautiful babies here.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Tee, the beautiful babies don't work Wednesdays midnight to six. This is the skank shift.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: What are you talking about? Look at all the honeys.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Cut that shit out.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: She smiled baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That's not cool.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Did she, or did she not smile?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It doesn't matter...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I'm telling you, they love that shit.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You're gonna screw up our plan.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: We're gonna get laid, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: First let's see what happens if we play it cool.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: What? You think she's gonna tell her pit-boss on us?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Don't make fun, I think we can get some free shit if we don't fuck around.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Who's fucking around? I'm not making fun. Let's do it, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: The trick is to look like you don't need it, then they give you shit for free.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Well, you look money, baby. We both look money.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That's where we make our scene.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You think they're watching?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Oh, they're watching all right. They're watching.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Double down.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What?!?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Double down, baby. You gotta double down on an eleven.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I know, but...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You gotta do it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...but that's two hundred dollars. This is blood money...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: If we don't look like we know what we're doing, then we may as well...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I'm telling you, baby, you always double down on an eleven.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah? Well obviously not always!

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Always, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm just saying, not in this particular case.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Always.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: But I lost! How can you say always?!?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...Well, you know, not counting the first table.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Thanks for clarifying that.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Hey, man, I'm down too, you know.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yea, how much?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I don't know, what? Thirty, Forty maybe.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Don't give me that shit. You know exactly how much you lost. What'd you drop?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Twenty... but I was down at least fifty. I'm sorry, I got hot at the crap table.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You won. There's nothing to be sorry about. You're a winner. I'm the fuckin loser. I should be sorry.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, don't talk like that, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Let's just leave.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, you're money. You're the big winner.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Who's the big winner?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Mikey's the big winner.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What an asshole.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Okay, Tee's the asshole, but Mikey's the big winner.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What an asshole.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: That was money. Tell me that wasn't money.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That was so demeaning...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: She smiled, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I can't believe what an asshole you are.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Did she, or did she not smile.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She was smiling at what an asshole you are.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: She was smiling at how money I am, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Let's go. I'm not paying for a room, and if we don't leave now we'll never make it.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Leave? The honey-baby's bringing us some cocktails.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What are you, nuts? You think she's coming back?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I know she's coming back.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, did you hear her? "You shouldn't leave without getting something for free." She wants to party, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You think so?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You gotta give Tee one thing. He's good with the ladies.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm too tired for this. Let's just go.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, this is what we came for. We met a beautiful baby and she likes you.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She likes you.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Whatever. We'll see. Daddy's gonna get her to bring a friend. We'll both get one. I don't care if I'm with her or one of her beautiful baby friends.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You gotta get that girl out of your head. It's time to move on. You're a stylish, successful, good looking cat. The ladies want to love you, you just gotta let them.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That's bullshit.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: It's not. You're money. Any of these ladies would be lucky to pull a cat like you.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's just that I've been out of the game so long. Trent, I was with her for six years. That's before AIDS. I'm scared. I don't know how to talk to them, I don't know...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You can't think like that, baby. It's hard, I know. I've been there. Not for six years, but I know. You just gotta get back out there.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's just tough, after sleeping with someone you love for so long, to be with someone new... who doesn't know what I like... and you gotta wear a jimmy...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...gotta...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...and then I'm struggling to impress some chick who's not half as classy as my girlfriend, who I'm not even really attracted to...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Oh fuck that. You don't have to try and impress anyone. You think I give a shit? You think I sweat that skanky whore waitress...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That was so fuckin' money. It was like that "Jedi mind" shit.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: That's what I'm telling you, baby. The babies love that stuff. They don't want all that sensitive shit. You start talking to them about puppy dogs and ice cream. They know what you want. What do you think? You think they don't?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I know. I know.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: They know what you want, believe me. Pretending is just a waste of time. You're gonna take them there eventually anyway. Don't apologize for it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm just trying to be a gentleman, show some respect...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Respect, my ass. They respect honesty. You see how they dress when they go out? They want to be noticed. You're just showing them it's working. You gotta get off this respect kick, baby. There ain't nothing wrong with letting them now that you're money and that you want to party.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Nice, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I should've said Renaissance, right? It went over her head.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, you did fine.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: "Age of Enlightenment". Shit. Like some waitress in a Las Vegas coffee shop is going to get an obscure French philosophical reference. How demeaning. I may as well have just said "Let me jump your ignorant bones."...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...Baby...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...It's just, I thought "Renaissance" was too Excaliber, it's the wrong casino. She would've gotten it, though...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You did fine. Don't sweat her. We're meeting our honeys soon. You know Christy's friend is going to be money.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I hope so.  We gotta go soon.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, relax. It's just down the hall. She's gotta change... we'll be fine.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: We didn't do so bad after all.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, we're money.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm Mike...  and this is my friend "Doubledown Trent".

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Stop.  Ladies, don't you double down on an eleven?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Hello, Lisa. I'm Trent. What a lovely makeup job.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Oh... a Dorothy.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Well... we're not in Kansas anymore.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What was the part?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Oh... "I love you... I can't believe you're doing this... Drugs are bad..." Whatever. After-School bullshit. The role is Brother.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: "Big Brother", "Little Brother"?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Wait... Wait... Just "Brother". So I go in. "Hello... Hi... We loved your guest spot on Baywatch... blah blah blah..." Whatever. So, I start to read, and, Mikey, I was money. I prepared for a week. It's a starring role. I'm crying... The casting director, she starts crying...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Wait...  She's crying. I finish. I hold up my finger like "Wait a second". They sit in silence for, like, at least five minutes. I look up and they all start clapping, and now they're all crying. Even the camera guy.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No! Not the camera guy!

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I'm telling you!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...So give me the fuckin part...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Right?... that I nailed it... Whatever. Then he says it's just that I'm a little old. I'm like "How old is the Brother?". He's like, he says this with a straight face, I swear to God, he says "Eleven."

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: So, what'd you say to him? "Double down."?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No, man. I need to use the phone.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I gotta use the phone.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, you'll check them tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Please, Tee. I have to use the phone. Sorry, man.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Hold on.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She asked me what I was thinking about? What should I have done? Lie?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You didn't have to get into it, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Sorry about interrupting...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Don't worry about me, baby. I just wanted you to have a good time.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Christy was nice...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I didn't even like her, to be honest.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She was hot.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: She really didn't do it for me, baby. How'd you like Dorothy?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't know. The whole Judy Garland thing kind of turned me on. Does that makes me some kind of fag?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: No, baby. You're money.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She didn't like me, anyway.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: She thought you were money.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I heard them talking. They both thought you were money.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah, a good friend.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, you take yourself out of the game. You start talking about puppy dogs and ice cream, of course it's gonna be on the friend tip.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I just don't think she liked me in that way.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, you're so money you don't even know it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Tee, girls don't go for me the way they go for you.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Michelle went for you, right.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That was different.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I was younger... It was college. You didn't go to college, you don't know what it's like. You screw chicks you have no business being with. They're young, they don't know any better.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: That's just plain silly. Your self- esteem is just low because she's with someone else. But thinking about it and talking about it all the time is bad. It's no good, man. You gotta get out there. The ladies want to love you, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I just need some time...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Why? So you can beat yourself up? Sitting around in that stuffy apartment. It's just plain bad for you, man. It's depressing. You've come so far. Remember the first week? After she told you? You couldn't even eat.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Don't remind me.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You just sat around drinking orange juice. Now look at you. Look how far you've come in just a few months. You got that part in that movie...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...a day...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...Whatever. It's work. You're doing what you love. What's she doing?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Selling scrap metal.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: See? And what does this guy she's with do?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: He drives a carriage.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: What?!?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I hear he drives a carriage around Central Park or something.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Please. And you're sweating him? You're "all that" and you're sweating some lawn jockey?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I hear she's getting real fat.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, she's the one who should be thinking about you. Sounds to me like you cut loose some dead weight. Trust me, Mikey, you're better off.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: I wish the game still had fights so I could bitch-slap Wayne.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: This version doesn't have fighting?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: No. Doesn't that suck?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What? That was the best part of the old game.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You guys are such assholes.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Aww... He got away?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What time's this party tonight?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: It starts at eight...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Who? Rob?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah. You met him once.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Yeah. He's a "rounder".

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...the Copa, in New York...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...through the kitchen...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ...Maybe. I mean you gotta hide all the lights...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...It looked money.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: How you guys doing?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: It's on.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Which one?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Minnie Pearl.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You looked right at her, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She didn't notice.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Don't sweat it, baby. This one's a lay-up.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Was I money?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't know. It was kind of a dick move if you ask me.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Why, baby? What'd I do wrong?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You asked her for her number, and then you tore it up.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: She didn't see.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: We got the digits, baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What a surprise.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: What's wrong? I saw you talking to that beautiful blonde baby.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Please, don't mess with me right now...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: We're not messing with you...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You're not just, like, fucking with me?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: No, baby!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: How long do I wait to call?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: A day.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Tomorrow?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: So, two days?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Yeah. I guess you could call it that.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: What the fuck..?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What an asshole. Didn't you see "Boys in the Hood"? Now one of us is gonna get shot.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You were off your ass back there! Where the hell did you learn to do all that twirly whirly shit?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I took a ballroom class with Michelle. I never danced with anyone but her, til tonight. That Lorraine chick is good.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You were good. Did you see how she was vibing you?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's not like that...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Don't give me that! She liked you, man.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I know she liked me. I mean, it's not like I wanted to do anything with her tonight.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Guys... Guys... I got it under control.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Oh. He's got it under control...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Bitch... You little bitch!

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Chelios to Roenick...!

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Because he's a bitch.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: That's so bullshit. This is so bullshit.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...against the computer.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: They're a finesse team...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: They're a bitch team... SCORE! Roenick!

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Fuck!!! That is so bullshit!

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I don't know. I guess kids were hitting each other or something.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You could make their heads bleed, though.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Yeah... If you hit them hard their heads bleed all over the ice and their legs convulse.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Is he cute? Ask him if he wants to stay for a cocktail!

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...Is he brown?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: What a surprise...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...How novel.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Oh, it's on, baby...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...It's on.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Is she looking at me, baby?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Now?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Is she looking now?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: No! She's not looking at you. She hasn't looked at you once. Will you stop asking if... Wait, she just looked.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: See, baby?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Yes she did.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Damn. Now I gotta go in early.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: That was pretty cold, dude.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: What was cold about it?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: It's on.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You think?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, I know it is. It's a black diamond trail...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...double diamond...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...but it's worth the risk. True or false: It's worth the risk.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: True.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Baby, don't talk that way, baby...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You are so money, and you don't even know it...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: That's what I keep trying to tell him.  You're so money, you don't even know...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...we're not...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You're like this big bear with claws and fangs...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...and big fuckin' teeth...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...and teeth... And she's like this little bunny cowering in the corner...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...shivering...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...And you're just looking at your claws like "How do I kill this bunny?"...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...You're just poking at it...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...Yeah. You're just gently batting it around... and the rabbit's all scared...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...and you got big claws and fangs...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...and fangs... and you're like "I don't know what to do. How do I kill this bunny?"...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...you're like a big bear.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...honestly...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...you're money...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...you're so fuckin mmmoney.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Now go over there and get those digits.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: You're money.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Now when you talk to her, I don't want you to be the guy in the PG-13 movie that everyone's pulling for. I want you to be the guy in the rated R movie who you're not sure if you like.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...Tomorrow, then a day.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...Yeah.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Definitely. Two days. That's the industry standard...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...I used to wait two days. Now everyone waits two days. Three days is kinda money now, don't you think?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...Yeah. But two's enough not to look anxious...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Yeah, but three days is kinda the money...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Laugh all you want, but if you call to soon you can scare off a nice baby who's ready to party.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Don't listen to him. You call whenever it feels right to you.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: You dick.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What'd you want me to do? Back down? He called me a bitch. We kept our rep.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...Anaheim...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: ...Whatever. Things are different here. It's not like New York, Mikey.

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...Oh, who would jack your fuckin K- car? He's right, Sue. You don't need no gat.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Listen. Just because I was the only one with the balls to stand up to them...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...Oh yeah, like "Cypress Hill" was gonna do anything...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Have you gotten laid once since you moved here? Did you fuck once?

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: ...Shut up, Sue...

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I know for a fact you haven't, because you never shut up about it. You're like a little whiney bitch...

turns.speaker: TRENT
turns.text: Sue!
